page.title: 01Ogmore Vale And Wyndham.
page.content: The former coal mining communities of Ogmore Vale and Wyndham,in the Ogmore Valley were established along the valley bottom and the lower slopes of mountains which rise to a height of over 400 metres. Terracing is the dominant feature of house building. The adult population has declined to about 2445. Lack of employment oppurtunities being the main reason. Notable buildings include the now empty Gwalia Stores. The most ancient buildings are the farmhouses and sheep farming which predates any other means of earning a living is carried on. A further feature of the area is a large conifer plantation called the Ogmore Forest. The largest remaining area of natural broadleaved woodland is the Aber Woods. {
